alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 2:57PM EST until December 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM BEGINS LATE TONIGHT... .Rain will transition to heavy wet snow after midnight tonight and continue through much of the first half of Monday. Snowfall rates of between 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible during the Monday morning commute, making travel very difficult. Scattered power outages are likely due to falling limbs from the sticky nature of the snow. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern Coos County. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...A snowstorm will bring plowable snow to the region with a period of moderate travel impacts expected. Periods of moderate to heavy snow and and the wet, sticky nature of the snow will be the biggest hazards. Snow clinging to tree limbs of conifers and leafed trees will lead to downed limbs and scattered to numerous power outages. Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Do not touch downed lines and report any power outages to your electric company. Travel is highly discouraged due to slick roadways and the possibility of downed trees and power lines.
